fuite en avant f (plural fuites en avant)

  1. (figuratively, idiomatic) Reckless sequence of actions taken to escape from circumstances deemed dangerous and which one does not want to face.
    (Can we verify(+) this sense?)
  2. Used other than figuratively or idiomatically: see fuite,‎ en,‎ avant.
    • 1876, Description des machines et procédés spécifiés dans les brevets d'invention, de perfectionnement et d'importation...‎[1]:
      De plus, le cône de la bourre, s'épanouissant par la pression, colle le long des parois de l'arme et prévient toute fuite en avant du projectile.
      What's more, the cone of the wadding, which expands under pressure, sticks to the sides of the weapon and prevents the projectile from flying forward.
trans: Reckless sequence of actions taken to escape from circumstances deemed dangerous and which one does not want to face.
Used other than figuratively or idiomatically: see fuite,‎ en,‎ avant.
